ygData.subject: Re: [EverQuest] I can't stinkin' log into Everquest!
ygData.msgSnippet: I dunno. it s my mom s comp.. And she has alot of RAM. But her comp was a display model so there s no telling what could ve been done to it... luv, -Su ...
ygData.messageBody:
I dunno. it's my mom's comp.. And she has alot of RAM. But her comp was a
display model so there's no telling what could've been done to it...
luv,
-Su

> Agreed....I use WinME on a AMD K6-3 450 with 256 megs ram, and have NO
> problem with lag in any normal stuff. Some zones of EQ, yes, but I run XG
> Midi emulation all the time with no system lag, and it's one of the
biggest
> resource hogs around. If you're lagging in Solitaire on a 1.5, something's
> seriously wrong...not enough ram maybe.
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: LAINE. Mikael (Nol) <laine@...>
> To: <EverQuest@yahoogroups.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, December 11, 2001 4:30 AM
> Subject: SV: [EverQuest] I can't stinkin' log into Everquest!
>
>
> ROFL, blaming that on Windows ME is ignorant and should probably be blamed
> on the configuration of Windows and the applications you have installed,
or
> maybe a hardware problem. But i bet you 10 bux that it's not a problem
with
> Windows ME.
>
> -domi
>
> -----Ursprungligt meddelande-----
> Från: Su [mailto:suceress@...]
> Skickat: den 11 december 2001 04:36
> Till: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com
> Ämne: Re: [EverQuest] I can't stinkin' log into Everquest!
>
>
>
> I haven't had too much trouble with lag on my Athlon, and I'm only
connected
> at 21k bc my phone lines are like 20 years old, I'm behind a "slick", and
> the phone company won't fix my lines.
> My mom, who has a 1.5Ghz pentium lags while playing offline games like
> spider solitaire-- because she has windows ME.
> luv,
> -Su
>
> > Athlon might be the problem. As of late many of the patches mention lag
> > related issues when incorporated with the AMD processors. There was a
> patch
> > this morning that may have solved the problem, but I believe there might
> > still be some issues related to the processor you have.
> >
> > Same as before.. Give them a few days and I'm sure they will have it
> working
> > correctly soon, if not already.
> >
> >
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Justin [mailto:blackcatsg@...]
> > Sent: Monday, December 10, 2001 2:41 PM

mx400
> > video card, a soundblaster audiology soundcard(xgamer) 512 mb ram, and a
> > 64.down/256up dsl connecton with MSN bvroadband and a 10 gb harrd drive
> (ata
> > 100) that should be enough info to solve the problem. So I do have lag
> but
> > it also takes longer to zone, about a minute or so.
